intro: Malesherbia fatimae, commonly known as the Fatima's malesherbia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
